intro: Centaurea nissana f. orbelica, commonly known as the Orbeli's cornflower, is a botanical variant of the species Centaurea nissana. It is characterized by its vibrant blue to purple flowers and bristly foliage, typical of the Asteraceae family. This subspecies is native to specific regions in the Eastern Mediterranean, particularly in areas of Turkey and Cyprus. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or arid environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and botanical collections.
